data.text: If you're putting clothes or a tent in that dry bag I'd make double sure that its' waterproofing lasts during sustained precipitation. Most bags that I've used have only a few hours of waterproofing in the worst of Arizona's monsoon season downpours before the dampness sets in. Putting a dry bag as light as the one in this picture, inside a seat bag would assist with keeping gear dry and the sway that you're referring to.

data.text: Fyi, many droppers, the reverb included, can have air push past a seal from a positive to a negative chamber when upwards pressure is applied in the dropped position, such as when you have a g out with weight on it like a dry bag. At least take a clamp to lock your post in place in case of a failure, if not removing lots of weight. Mostly applicable for single track.
